[jadeo suave] ¿Pero qué acabo de—espera, ¿ese era Marcus? [muy bajito] ¿El mismo chaval que ayer se escondió detrás de la caja cuando la señora Patterson le hizo una pregunta? [pausa] O sea, es que acaba de... madre mía, ha ido directo al cliente. [emocionado] ¡Sin dudarlo ni nada! Sin más, le ha preguntado si necesitaba ayuda para encontrar algo. [risita] Y cuando ella le ha dicho que no encontraba el tahini, no se ha, eh... no se ha quedado paralizado ni nada. [con orgullo] Le ha explicado dónde estaba—pasillo 7 con la comida internacional, no con la mantequilla de cacahuete donde todo el mundo piensa que estaría. [cálido] ¡Y luego la ha acompañado hasta allí!

[suspiro] Sabes, es que llevo, eh... llevo semanas intentando que salga de su caparazón. [lentamente] Nada parecía funcionar. Intenté ponerle con los cajeros más simpáticos, le di tareas sencillas, pero él simplemente... no sé, se encogía sobre sí mismo. [frustrado] Estaba empezando a pensar que a lo mejor este no era el trabajo adecuado para él.

[risa] ¡Pero míralo ahora! [muy sinceramente] Está sonriendo mientras habla con otro cliente. [dejando la frase sin terminar] A lo mejor solo necesitaba encontrar su momento para... [feliz] Dios, qué orgullosa estoy de él ahora mismo. [muy emocionado] ¡Espera a que se lo cuente a Sarah!

original_conversation.content:
[gasp softly] Did I just see—wait, was that Marcus? [very quietly] The same kid who literally hid behind the register yesterday when Mrs. Patterson asked him a question? [pause] I mean, he just... wow, he walked right up to that customer. [excited] No hesitation, nothing! Just straight up asked if they needed help finding something. [chuckle] And when she said she couldn't find the tahini, he didn't, um... he didn't freeze up or anything. [proudly] He actually explained where it was—aisle seven with the international foods, not with the peanut butter where everyone thinks it'd be. [warm] Then he actually walked her there himself!

[sigh] You know, I've been trying to, uh... trying to coax him out of his shell for weeks now. [slowly] Nothing seemed to work. I tried pairing him with our friendliest cashiers, gave him simple tasks, but he'd just... I don't know, shrink into himself. [frustrated] I was starting to think maybe this wasn't the right job for him. 

[laugh] But look at him now! [very sincerely] He's actually smiling while talking to another customer. [trailing off] Maybe he just needed to find his own moment to... [happy] God, I'm so proud of him right now. [very excited] Wait till I tell Sarah about this!

subject: Your shy grocery bagger trainee just confidently helped a customer find exactly what they needed
